jequest(url, method='get', payload={}, elapsed=False, print_error=False, timeout=None, ipaddr=None, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

This functions will be called the http requests.

Parameters:

  • url â€“

  • method (optional) â€“ |default| 'get'

  • payload (optional) â€“ |default| {}

  • elapsed (optional) â€“ |default| False

  • print_error (optional) â€“ |default| False

  • timeout (optional) â€“ Timeout seconds |default| None

  • ipaddr (optional) â€“ Change the request IP address in http request |default| None

  • **kwargs â€“ Optional arguments that request takes.

Return type:

dict

Returns:

icon_rpc_call(url=None, method=None, timeout=5000, params={}, payload={}, print_error=False, reset_error=True, raise_on_failure=False, store_request_payload=True, return_key=None, http_method='post')ïƒ

pawnlib.utils.log moduleïƒ

from pawnlib.utils import log
class CustomLog(name)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

Parameters:

name â€“ logger name

Example

from pawnlib.utils.log import CustomLog

file_name = './time_log.txt'
logger = CustomLog("custom_log")
logger.set_level('DEBUG')
logger.stream_handler("INFO")
logger.time_rotate_handler(filename=file_name,
                           when="M",
                           interval=2,
                           backup_count=3,
                           level="INFO"
                           )
idx = 1
logger.log.debug(logger.log_formatter(f'debug {idx}'))
logger.log.info(logger.log_formatter(f'info {idx}'))
logger.log.warning(logger.log_formatter(f'warning {idx}'))
logger.log.error(logger.log_formatter(f'error {idx}'))
logger.log.critical(logger.log_formatter(f'critical {idx}'))
set_level(level)[source]ïƒ
log_formatter(msg)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

msg â€“

Returns:

stream_handler(level)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

level â€“

Note

level

  • â€œDEBUGâ€ : logging.DEBUG ,

  • â€œINFOâ€ : logging.INFO ,

  • â€œWARNINGâ€ : logging.WARNING ,

  • â€œERRORâ€ : logging.ERROR ,

  • â€œCRITICALâ€ : logging.CRITICAL ,

Returns:

file_handler(file_name, mode)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • file_name â€“ ~.txt / ~.log

  • mode â€“ â€œwâ€ / â€œaâ€

Returns:

file_rotating_handler(file_name, mode, level, backup_count, log_max_size)[source]ïƒ
Parameters:

  • file_name â€“ fileì˜ ì´ë¦„ , ~.txt / ~.log

class AppLogger(app_name='default', log_level='INFO', log_path='./logs', markup=True, stdout=False, stdout_level='INFO', stdout_log_formatter='%H:%M:%S,%f', log_format=None, debug=False, use_hook_exception=True, exception_handler='', **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

Parameters:

  • app_name (str, optional) â€“ application name(=file name) |default| 'default'

  • log_level (Literal[â€˜INFOâ€™, â€˜WARNâ€™, â€˜DEBUGâ€™], optional) â€“ log level |default| 'INFO'

  • log_path (str, optional) â€“ log file path |default| './logs'

  • stdout (bool, optional) â€“ Enable stdout, Adding Hook for another library logging. |default| False

  • markup (bool, optional) â€“ Enable markup for stdout logging. |default| True

  • stdout_level (Literal[â€˜INFOâ€™, â€˜WARNâ€™, â€˜DEBUGâ€™, â€˜NOTSETâ€™], optional) â€“ stdout log level |default| 'INFO'

  • stdout_log_formatter (Callable, optional) â€“ stdout log formatter (function) |default| '%H:%M:%S,%f'

  • log_format (Optional[str], optional) â€“ log format / [%(asctime)s] %(name)s::â€ â€œ%(filename)s/%(funcName)s(%(lineno)d) %(message)s |default| None

  • use_hook_exception (bool, optional) â€“ Select whether to log exception errors. |default| True

  • exception_handler (Callable, optional) â€“ Exception handling function |default| ''

  • debug (bool, optional) â€“ |default| False

class TelegramBot(bot_token=None, chat_id=None)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

A class to interact with the Telegram Bot API.

Parameters:

  • bot_token (optional) â€“ Telegram bot token. If not provided, it will be fetched from the â€˜TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKENâ€™ environment variable. |default| None

  • chat_id (optional) â€“ Chat ID to send messages to. If not provided, it will be fetched from the â€˜TELEGRAM_CHAT_IDâ€™ environment variable or determined dynamically. |default| None

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If the bot token is not provided either as an argument or an environment variable.

Example

bot = TelegramBot(bot_token="your_bot_token", chat_id="your_chat_id")
bot.send_message("Hello, world!")
bot.send_html_message("<b>Hello, world!</b>")
bot.send_plain_text_message("Just plain text.")
bot.send_dict_message({"key": "value"})
escape_markdown(text)[source]ïƒ

Escape Markdown special characters for MarkdownV2.

Parameters:

text â€“ The text to escape.

Returns:

The escaped text.

Example

bot = TelegramBot(bot_token="your_bot_token", chat_id="your_chat_id")
escaped_text = bot.escape_markdown("Hello *world*!")
print(escaped_text)  # Output: Hello \*world\*!

from pawnlib.utils import operate_handler
class ThreadPoolRunner(func=None, tasks=[], max_workers=20, verbose=0, sleep=1)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

A class that runs a function with multiple arguments in parallel using a thread pool.

Parameters:

  • func (function, optional) â€“ The function to run in parallel. |default| None

  • tasks (list, optional) â€“ A list of arguments to pass to the function. |default| []

  • max_workers (int, optional) â€“ The maximum number of worker threads to use. |default| 20

  • verbose (int, optional) â€“ Whether to print the results of each task as they complete. |default| 0

  • sleep (int, optional) â€“ The number of seconds to sleep between runs when using forever_run. |default| 1

Example

runner = ThreadPoolRunner(func=my_function, tasks=my_args, max_workers=10, verbose=1, sleep=5)
results = runner.run()
runner.forever_run()
initializer_worker()[source]ïƒ

A method that is run once by each worker thread when the thread pool is created.

run()[source]ïƒ

Run the function with the given arguments in parallel using a thread pool.

Returns:

A list of results from each task.

Return type:

list

static log_results(results)[source]ïƒ

Print the results of each task as they complete.

Parameters:

results (list) â€“ A list of results from each task.

forever_run()[source]ïƒ

Run the function with the given arguments in parallel using a thread pool indefinitely.

stop()[source]ïƒ

Stop the forever_run loop.

class Daemon(pidfile, func=None, stdin=None, stdout=None, stderr=None, home_dir='.', umask=18, verbose=1, use_gevent=False, use_eventlet=False)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

A generic daemon class. Usage 1: subclass the Daemon class and override the run() method Usage 2: subclass the Daemon class and use func parameter

Parameters:

  • pidfile â€“ pid file location

  • func (optional) â€“ function to run as daemon |default| None

  • stdin (optional) â€“ standard input , The default is sys.stdin, and providing a filename will output to a file. |default| None

  • stdout (optional) â€“ standard output, The default is sys.stdout, and providing a filename will output to a file. |default| None

  • stderr (optional) â€“ standard error, The default is sys.stderr, and providing a filename will output to a file. |default| None

  • home_dir (optional) â€“ home directory |default| '.'

  • umask (optional) â€“ umask |default| 18

  • verbose (optional) â€“ verbosity level |default| 1

  • use_gevent (bool, optional) â€“ use gevent |default| False

  • use_eventlet (bool, optional) â€“ use eventlet |default| False

Example

from pawnlib.utils.operate_handler import Daemon

def main():
    while True:
        print(f"main loop")
        print("start daemon")
        time.sleep(5)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    if len(sys.argv) != 2:
        sys.exit()
    command = sys.argv[1]
    daemon = Daemon(
        pidfile="/tmp/jmon_agent.pid",
        func=main
    )
    if command == "start":
        daemon.start()
    elif command == "stop":
        daemon.stop()
    else:
        print("command not found [start/stop]")

class WaitStateLoop(loop_function, exit_function, timeout=30, delay=0.5, text='WaitStateLoop')[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

loop_function is continuously executed and values â€‹â€‹are compared with exit_function.

Parameters:

  • loop_function (Callable) â€“ function to run continuously

  • exit_function (Callable) â€“ function to exit the loop

  • timeout (optional) â€“ |default| 30

  • delay (optional) â€“ sleep time |default| 0.5

  • text (optional) â€“ text message |default| 'WaitStateLoop'

Example

from pawnlib.utils.operate_handler import WaitStateLoop
from functools import partial

def check_func(param=None):
    time.sleep(0.2)
    random_int = random.randint(1, 1000)
    # print(f"param= {param}, random_int = {random_int}")
    return random_int

def loop_exit_func(result):
    if result % 10 == 1.5:
        return True
    return False

WaitStateLoop(
    loop_function=partial(check_func, "param_one"),
    exit_function=loop_exit_func,
    timeout=10
).run()

pawnlib.utils.icx_signer moduleïƒ

from pawnlib.utils import icx_signer
guess_wallet_type(data)[source]ïƒ

Guesses the type of wallet based on the provided data.

Parameters:

data (str or object) â€“ The data to analyze and determine the wallet type.

Returns:

The guessed wallet type. It can be â€œprivate_keyâ€ for a private key wallet, â€œjsonâ€ for a JSON wallet, or None if the type cannot be determined.

Return type:

str or None

This function attempts to determine the type of a wallet based on the provided data. If the data parameter is a string and its length is either 66 or 64 characters, it is considered a PrivateKey wallet type. If the data parameter is a valid JSON object, it is considered a JSON wallet type. If the wallet type cannot be determined, None is returned.

Example:

# Example 1: PrivateKey wallet type
wallet_data = "0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef"
wallet_type = guess_wallet_type(wallet_data)
# wallet_type = "private_key"

# Example 2: JSON wallet type
wallet_data = '{"address": "0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef"}'
wallet_type = guess_wallet_type(wallet_data)
# wallet_type = "json"

# Example 3: Unknown wallet type
wallet_data = 12345
wallet_type = guess_wallet_type(wallet_data)
# wallet_type = None
Raises:

None
